One of the most beautiful places in BsAs. The Rosedal is one of my favourite corners of BsAs. It offers some tranquility in a city that can become overwhelming at times, definitely try and pay it a visit if you have time.
very nice area. Nice for walking. Clean and very well maintained.All the area has very nice parks and monuments.The rose garden is unique, specially in spring.

Peaceful and beautiful open place to enjoy. With more than 18000 rosebushes along 8,4 acres, this rose garden created in 1914 has sheltered thousands or romantic stories for "porteños" and visitors as well as great moments shared with friends in their youth and elder days. Beautifully maintained throughout the years, it is a place to enjoy not only nature and pure air but also art, as it has several artworks: statues and busts of famous international artists are spread allover the place. Leaving aside technical aspects, it is a peaceful, more than agreable place, with fantastic views, a nice lake to rent a boat and row (with your hands as traditionally or your legs on pedals), an Hellenic bridge, an Andalusian patio donated by the city of Seville (Spain) and the wonderful smell of roses. Do not miss it, take a sunny afternoon for reward your soul and spirit.

peaceful. A nice place to escape the busy city and see the roses and sit for a few minutes to enjoy nature. Note that the garden is on an island in the middle of the lake, not in the area outside of it.

A haven of peace and tranquility in a huge city. The rose garden in Buenos Aires is a very tranquil and peaceful place to sit and enjoy and sometimes smell the roses. The well manicured and well tended roses and the paths around are a fantastic sight. The variety of roses is astonishing to say the least.

A nice break from the bustling of the city. It was a pleasant surprise when we walked through this rose garden. It was big and well-maintained. We don't know much about roses, but they were just beautiful.

Better visit during summer. I visited Rosedal when it seemed to be past its best time. Even so the place very pretty and the park and lake close to it make it a nice place to pass time anyway. The surroundings of Rosedal are popular for people to do exercise but once you step inside the gates the atmosphere is peaceful and serene.
beautiful. The rose garden was recommended to us by our hotel concierge and it did not dissapoint. Well maintained and excellent people watching.

Gorgeous!. Beautifully landscaped and meticulously manicured, this rose garden is one of the largest and most breathtaking I've ever seen. Absolutely worth a visit. Be sure to walk through all the circular paths to enjoy all the different roses.
Why was it not open?. We wanted to see the Paseo del Rosedal and walked a distance to get there...only to find it closed on a Wednesday afternoon. Disappointing....
Best place to jog in Buenos Aires. Around a lake surrounding a beautiful rose garden you find people of all ages walking, jogging, skating or just sunbathing.
Pretty beautiful. Along with the Bosques de Palermo and the Japanese Gardens this is a place not to be missed. The grounds are beautifully maintained

Really lovely open space. I was recommended to go to this place by a local. It wasn't marked on my tourist map, so I would never have otherwise found it. It's a really beautiful park, very relaxing and quiet. Locals hang out nearby-many on roller blades or dog walking. In some ways it reminded me of Hyde Park in London. It was nice to get a feel for what it's like to live in BA.

Clean and nice park. The park is very nice and clean. Good for a few hours time out in the loud and dirty city of buenos aires. Unfortunately, you can still hear the noises of the city - still, worth a trip...

Beautiful!. My friends and I were staying in Palermo so we rented some bikes to ride throgh the "Bosques de Palermo" and we loved the "Rosedal". It was one of our favorite places in BsAs. It was clean and well-groomed. Definitely a place that I want to go back when in BsAs again.

Beautiful rose gardens and lake in Buenos Aires. This is an incredibly well maintained garden with a small lake. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit there and recommend its beauty and quiet to those looking for an alternative morning or afternoon to the noise and traffic of the city.

Big Park with Golf Lakes and more!. Take your time. Under suggestions of my tour guide I rent a bike and enjoy a day around the park. It was the perfect option as it is so big and you can stop to enjoy a Rose Garden and stop for a drink around to come back and continue exploring like for ex the Japanese Garden. A nice day !

Favorite place in all of Bs.As.. I was here when the roses were in perfect bloom. The smell was overwhelming! I visited here on multiple occasions to stroll, meditate, relax, and read. It's alongside the lake in parque 3 de febrero where there are many things to do. Great place for running and walking around the lake.

peace among the chaos. Not many outdoor parks in BsAs are as well-manicured and none are as romantic as this one. Stroll through the rose garden with your sweetie, exit the garden to the shade trees, bring a little picnic lunch and spend the afternoon lying down on the grass, porteño-style.There's a bunch of vendors selling sodas and ice creams and Starbucks on the other side of the little lake.
Great atmosphere. this place is amazing. We went there in a bike tour and we stayed there for a while drinking a "yerba mate"
Beautiful and calm. It's a great place for taking a walk or just sit on a bench and look at the roses, or the peddle boats around the paseo.

PORTEÑOS SHOWING OFF. This is a place where residents go to sunbathe, skate, and generally hang around. You can hire a Mateo ( a horse driven cart) or a pair of skates and show off your skills. A few a really talented but the majority are there to soak the atmosphere. There's also a lake where you can hire a pedallo or row around the central island.

Take a walk in the park. I like everything about the Rosedal. You can walk the oval with the other walkers. You can walk through the rose garden which, when in bloom is spectacular. You can sit in the shade or take a ride in a paddle boat. There's an interesting little art museum in the park. Recommended!
Nice park in the Palermo area. Pleasant walk besides the lakes. There are peddle boats that can be a good workout. It was late winter so the roses were not in bloom
Nice Place. Very nice, well maintained place with several of different roses. A romantic place in a Palermo park. It worth to walk by.

Beautiful place. We were there on the 31st of December and unfortunately it was closed. But from the park it was possible to see many beautiful roses, in different colors, in a nice projected yard. It is located in a very beautiful area, nearby MALBA and Japanese Garden, so you can do these three places in the same day.

Visit in September when the most roses are in bloom!. There are always roses blooming here but in early spring the place is magical! such gorgeous blossoms. It's a nice oasis in the 3 de Febrero park because no dogs allowed and people aren't allowed to sit in the grass, either. The grass is totally plush and gorgeous because it's watered regularly. Also great because there are public restrooms in side the rose garden (near the busts) that are relatively clean. Worth a look for sure. You can cut through the front side and walk all the way back, over the bridge in the back, and exit to the other side of the part right at the entrance to the Eduardo Sivori museum-perfect!
Beautiful. A really beautiful oasis in the middle of the city...although its advised to go on a less hotter day and with plenty of sunscreen :)...beautiful roses and ambience !

A beautiful spot on Spring and Autumn. The oppositions of the Sun's position really affects the rose's performance on this lovely place. By late march it's possible to see lot's of tones of brown and old yellow, and in mid october beautiful and vivid tones of rose and orange. I'd avoid it in weekends due the huge amount of people cruising by.
Beautiful.. I really enjoyed seeing the peaceful and artistic side of Buenos Aires. It's a great place to take a date or just a casual walk with some friends. Very relaxing and enjoyable.

Great place for a glass of wine and walk to enjoy nature right in the Middle of Palermo. We stayed in Palermo Soho and needed something relaxing to do on one of the few days I didn't have anything planned. My wife and I enjoyed walking through the park, watching the ducks and the people.
Beautiful park in the heart of Palermo. Recommended for the flowers amateurs, this place is excellent for a walk and for reading a book smelling the beautiful blooms on the trees.
beautiful. Its a nice place to walk in a sunny day, beatiful flowers and nice place to see, great pictures and calm to take a time

Beautiful Oasis. We happend through here today and were amazed by the beauty of this "park". The roses were well cared for, lawns well maintained and several of the geese had baby goslings hanging around their mothers.Only complaint is that there needs to be more benches under trees. It was almost 90 degrees when we were there and it was challenging to find some place to sit out of the sun.
Beautiful. Best rose garden we have seen on all out trips. Beats Butchart rose garden and covers a much larger area because it's just roses.

Really beautiful rose garden. This is a really beautiful part of BA. A little out of the way compared to most other tourist attractions but well worth getting to. The roses are kept in beautiful condition and it has some other nice parts around including a Greek style bridge.

Excelent. Very pretty, peaceful, romantic place. Its free to go there, its awesome to take pictures, to eat some ice cream, to watch the ducks... There is a little lake with pedal boats for renting...
Beautiful in November. November is the ideal time to view it while the Jacaradas trees are in full blossom. The birds were nesting, the roses and lawns were manicured to perfection.
Old Buenos Aires revived. This very traditional "Paseo" is a must for everyone to take off some steam. Exploring it takes you back to the 19th century when it was designed and built.

Beautiful way to spend an afternoon. The rose garden is FREE! And not only that, it's beautiful, with lots of beautiful flowers (yes, of course lots of roses), and the smell is incredible. It's tranquil, with lots of benches and walkways and fountains. Wish I had've gotten a paddleboat. Lovely!

Lovely public garden away from the hustle. Although we went in spring before many roses were blooming (oct 10) we still enjoyed a half hour stroll through this lovely rose garden. Plenty of taxis are available at the exit and it's free.

Lovely ride on the pedalos. We went with my daughter (5) and nephew (10) on the pedalos and had great fun. You have enough time to go round the lake once and not rushing at all. The Rosedal is very pretty to look at from the lake and also to walk around if the children let you.Great for a sunny day!

Green haven. OK - we know - best to go see a rose garden in the right season. Not always possible so we missed everything in full bloom. That said, we were impressed with the fantastic layout, the perfectly kept gardens and the feeling of tranquility despite being in the middle of the city. The walk around is easy and nearly all the plants.trees are identified. Also take a stroll across the white bridge which is built over the lake.

Best workout circuit in the city. It is beautiful, conveniently located and practical. The rose garden is stunning and even more so, the Patio Andaluz. This is where i go for a good power walk around the lake, stretching under the trees and then just chilling out in the Patio if I have the time.

Paradise in the middle of the city. This places is a Nature Paradise whit a lot of trees and flowers that you can know. All this specimens all correctly labeled and identified . Is a very nice and quiet place to go with your family.
Beautiful oasis in Argentina. We went in July, so most of the flowers were not in bloom, but the garden was beautiful and is a must see!
sunny day. beutifull for walking and relaxing, in the downtown, perfect area for the (porteños) forget the sounds of the city

Great park to relax. If you are looking for a very nice place to relax this is a wonderfull spot. Next to this place you can find lots of green an colorful corners it's a huge park . You can rent skateboards, etc

A breath of fresh air from all the concrete. After almost two weeks in just Buenos Aires, we and the kids yearned for some greenery. The lovely people at our hotel recommended that we visit "Palermo Woods" and check out the rose garden. We bought a blanket, some meats and cheeses and bread to make sandwiches, and had a relaxing day on a warmish Saturday afternoon people watching, and letting the kids run around and then nap in the grass. There are a lot of joggers, rollerbladers, and people on rental bikes if that is your sort of thing. Highly recommended!

Beautiful parks lots to see, jog, walk, rollerblade. If the weather is nice, put on your exercise clothes and head down to this area. The round jogging track is full of sites and sounds on Saturday mornings!
Bosques de Palermo. Beautiful, it is located inside Palermo parks, near the Jardin Japones that also worth the visit.
Beautiful place. Beautiful place, but nos as big as I expected. I went in the Fall - maybe it looks better in Spring.

Great, gorgeus garden. It´s a nice place to walk around in Buenos Aires, like a big lung in the middle of the city.
Great to spend a relaxing time, watching the beautiful colorful roses and doing exercise or simply walking around the lake.
You can´t miss this place is you go to Buenos Aires!
Nice nature place. Enjoyed the Platenatarium (Spanish only) and the Rosedal park. Sad to see that it has a fence and it closes around 5pm.
Beautiful Rose Garden. Nice to spend a sunny afternoon enjoying a glamorous rose garden in the heart of Buenos Aires City.

Amazing site in-town. Beautiful gardens, and a very nice place where people go to excersice or just for a walk in "Buenos Aires Woods". Very clean and interesting promenade. Totally reccomend to take a walk around it !

Beautiful and serene . . . rose garden, lake and island. Rosedal is a lovely, peaceful place to meander or sit and ponder as there are many benches available. It is comprised of over 3 hectares and YPF can be credited for its restoration and upkeep. Of its 18,000 rose plants, 5,000 were planted in 2008 by YPF. Enclosed within the rose garden is a special area for the New Roses. Several roses also have their awards displayed next to them. Monuments are dispersed among the area including over 20 busts of poets and writers. Around the fountain are several signs in both Spanish and English describing the sculptures, listing the names of the busts, etc. A bridge leads to a small island with bamboo that is only accessible via that bridge. The beautiful lake adds to the picturesque vision of this special space.

A favorite spot of mine. I visited this garden twice during my two weeks in Buenos Aires, the first time being brought by a friend from BA. I went back a couple of days later to take pictures and hang out. Had I been staying closer, I would have gone more. It was beautiful! Many people about but still felt peaceful. The whole park system within which the Rose Garden sits is great for a day of chilling out in a green space without leaving Buenos Aires.
Beautiful roses. great place to spend a summer afternoon, rent one of those pedal boats if you can, it was fun for me to do that.Walk around and enjoy the nature.

a green spot in the middle of the city. every time I go to BsAs I try to go for a run or a walk to el Rosedal. don't miss the walk inside the place where there are hundreds of beutiful different thpes of roses.You can then have a cofee at the Sivori coffee place and you could enter the Sivori Museum and enjoy this
Excellet!. It was simply beautiful with surprisingly clean bathrooms too!
Beautiful place. It is a beautiful place to visit. It is a big park with thousands of different kind of roses. A great spot for picturesque pictures!
Beautiful gardens. This area is beautiful, relaxing and charming worth several photos and pleasant to walk through or roller skate around.

A paradise in Buenos Aires. This is one of the finest places to go in the Palermo Woods. Roses of different kinds all over. And the busts of many spanish poets (plus Shakespeare) all over. You can easily spend a morning or an afternoon there. I've seen nothing like it all over the world. Every sunday there are free music concerts in the afternoon. A must.

A charming and romantic place in BsAs. A marvellous place for couples. You can spend a nice afternoon with a special person among the roses and at the awesome Andaluz patio. Why not propose the love of your life here???
Roses, Roses, Roses!. specially on spring and summer days, plenty of roses bloom around you. a nice spot to walk around, enjoy a book or just sit and smell the roses!

Smells good! hehehe. The place is really nice. Full of flowers everywhere, the smell of roses is fantastic... you can just walk between the flowers, the gardens, see the sunset and the enormous quantity of birds of this place. The "Paseo" is also great, with seats and some view points. Very romantic place, good for couples or travelers who wanna be in a charmy place to see the sunset. I Recommend it.!

Rose garden, beautiful but with low maintenance. It is breath-taking in parts and you will be amazed with the different roses.However, they could do a bit more maintenance on the place.If you are already here, also visit the Japanese Garden, the Botanic Garden and the Bosques de Palermo, all across the street
Amazing Landscaping!!. Beautyfull garden great people , romantic place and good girls around it

Pays the travel!. The Rosedal is a rose garden. It has roses from al over the world. That garden is very pleasant to see and to walk around just to find winner roses from past festivals. It worth the visit even if it is not spurt time.

For all rose lovers. This place have may prized roses and is a must if you like plants and gardening, but also if you like new frangrances. The garden is well kept and a good tour for both couples and families.

Roses galore. This is a beautiful park full of sculptures and roses. It's an oasis of tranquility and well worth a taxi ride to get there. I recommend taking a walk around the lake and watching people rollerblade, cycle, walk, and jog. Buy a chorripan and sit on one of the many benches and just soak up the atmosphere.
Don't go on a hot day!. Enjoyed the rose garden but most of the blooms were gone when we were there and it was very hot.

Nice place for rose lovers, but.... We went there on purpose, with the idea of starting our week with a refreshing and relaxing walk through thousands of different rose species. The place is lovely, but we saw it from outside only: it was monday morning, and on mondays (for some non understandable reasons, since it is a public place with free entrance) the garden is closed! As far as we could see, the place is anyway worth an hour or two of your time.
Pleasure for your eyes. Great choice for walking and touring the labyrinthine world full of roses. A beautiful way to see the autochthonous flora. Completely remodeled.
Romantic Roses!. Beautifully refurbished and laid out, the Rosedal is always a center of Palermo exercise buffs and romantic couples! Be sure to stop and smell the roses!!
Roses and more roses. If you like them this is the place to go specially in spring.

The perfect park for a picknic and being active...a must for tourists.. As I live in Buenos Aires for almost a year now, and have visited the city severel times before - I have been to Palermo, and "Paseo del Rosedal" many times, as it is one of our favorite places in Bs.As. Even though we have to travel 1,5 hours to get there we do it often.It is a wonderful area, all year, but of course if you specificly go for the roses, then summer is the best time. I have been there 2 times in January 2012, and the atmosphere and the roses at spectacular. Everything is kept in a very nice way, and it is spot where you can soak in peace and quiet while your eyes are spoiled with colours and scents.Bring your own food and drinks for a picknic or buy some at the many places where they offer. You can rent rollers, bikes, etc. if you want to be active or just watch all the people who come there to excersice. The Paseo del Rosedal is a park which is a part of the big park complex in Palermo.It is a MUST VISIT for all tourists in this great city, no matter in which way you want to "use" it...:-))There are a lot of bus lines which reaches the area, so it is easy to go.Enjoy.........you will love it.

A MUST GO in Buenos Aires. and better yet if you can also bring your kids or nephews! what you can do there: rent bikes and go for a ride around the park, rent boats and go around the lake, bring your roller-blades and stroll around a perfect path around the lake. Go for a walk or run. Bring everything you need and organize a pic-nic, or buy a few things at the local kiosk and eat and drink anywhere on the grass. and last but not least, visit the museum overlooking the lake, it is a tiny museum with a lovely coffee place in the inner patio.

go when the roses are flowering. the big attraction obviously are all the different kinds of roses, including the new and special ones. So the ideal time to visit is when the roses are in bloom, in summer. The smell and all the lush colours are overwhelming. Without the blooming roses it is just a "normal" well kept park as there are quite a few in BsAs

Rent Rollerblades at the Rosedale.. I lived in BA for a couple of months and really loved going to El Rosedal to rent rollerblades and blade around the loop. Weekends are more crowded, better to get there early because it gets really packed on the loop and you can run into bladers, families, etc. There are 4 or 5 different people renting rollerblades. Take a walk around and check them out to see who has the best skates. None of them are great, but they are functional and cheap, like 4 or five dollars per hour. There are people playing roller hockey, lovers strolling through the bridges and pergolas, and tons of futbol (soccer) games.

Best park in BA. Loved this place nice and quiet space in the busy city and well worth a visit, go on the weekend and Rollerblade or bike ride round the lake where you can mingle with the local people great fun.
The most beautiful park I have ever visited.. To be surrounded by rose gardens of all colors and sizes is priceless

A feast for your eyes. After visiting the Japanese Garden of Buenos Aires (beautiful, by the way), we heard about the Rosedal, and decided to walk over. It was a 20 minute walk, along some busy avenues, until we arrived in a gorgeous wooden bridge that goes over a portion of the lake, and then takes you to the Rosedal. We were stunned by the quantity and variety of roses, the beautiful colors, the beautiful design of the garden, and the tranquility of the place. It's excellent for a romantic stroll, for photo enthusiasts, or just to spend a lazy afternoon reading a book. I highly recommend it.

Beautiful Rose Garden and Park. The Rosedal has been recently refurbished and it looks great with working fountains, solid green lawns and really gorgeous roses. It's a lovely thing to do during the day when you want a little quiet time.

lovely garden. My partner and I spent part of a late afternoon at the end of Febuary in this well-cared for garden. Even though it is the end of the summer here the plants were generally in great shape with most in full flower. The design is classic and formal with massed plantings of single varieties. So far it is the best garden we have seen.
